    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    filterByMonth()
    This method sets the appointment table to show only appointments within the current month.
    void
    filterByWeek()
    This method sets the appointment table to show only appointments within the current calendar week.
    void
    initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
    This method sets up the Appointment screen to be populated with all existing appointments (see populateAppointmentTable).
    void
    onAddClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method redirects users to the Add Appointment screen when the Add button is clicked.
    void
    onCustomerClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method redirects the user to the Customers screen when they click the Customers button.
    void
    onDelete()
    This method deletes an appointment if a selection if made, if not the user is prompted to select an appointment.
    void
    onLogoutClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method redirects the user to the Login screen, as well as clearing the current user object (to be reset on next login) when the Logout button is clicked.
    void
    onModifyClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method redirects the user to the Modify Appointment screen if an appointment is selected, if not they get an alert prompting them to select an appointment.
    void
    onReportClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method redirects the user to the Reports screen when they click the Reports button.
    void
    populateAppointmentTable()
    This method populates the Appointments table with existing appointments (start and end date are only displayed as Strings for formatting purposes (using lambda expressions), the objects themselves use LocalDateTime and are stored as such)
    void
    showAllAppointments()
    This method sets the appointment table to show all appointments.

  • Method Details

    • onLogoutClick

      public void onLogoutClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method redirects the user to the Login screen, as well as clearing the current user object (to be reset on next login) when the Logout button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      event -
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onAddClick

      public void onAddClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method redirects users to the Add Appointment screen when the Add button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      event -
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onModifyClick

      public void onModifyClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method redirects the user to the Modify Appointment screen if an appointment is selected, if not they get an alert prompting them to select an appointment.
      Parameters:
      event -
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onDelete

      public void onDelete() throws SQLException
      This method deletes an appointment if a selection if made, if not the user is prompted to select an appointment. Alerts are also given to ask if they are sure, to confirm the delete was successful, or to let the user know it was unsuccessful.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • onCustomerClick

      public void onCustomerClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method redirects the user to the Customers screen when they click the Customers button.
      Parameters:
      event -
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onReportClick

      public void onReportClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method redirects the user to the Reports screen when they click the Reports button.
      Parameters:
      event -
      Throws:
      IOException

    • filterByWeek

      public void filterByWeek()
      This method sets the appointment table to show only appointments within the current calendar week. When selected the other radio button choices are set to false to prevent multiple selections.

    • filterByMonth

      public void filterByMonth()
      This method sets the appointment table to show only appointments within the current month. When selected the other radio button choices are set to false to prevent multiple selections.

    • showAllAppointments

      public void showAllAppointments()
      This method sets the appointment table to show all appointments. Then sets the by week and by month radio buttons to false so only one selection is made at a time.

    • populateAppointmentTable

      public void populateAppointmentTable() throws SQLException
      This method populates the Appointments table with existing appointments (start and end date are only displayed as Strings for formatting purposes (using lambda expressions), the objects themselves use LocalDateTime and are stored as such)
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method sets up the Appointment screen to be populated with all existing appointments (see populateAppointmentTable).
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url -
      resourceBundle -
